title: Potion of wonder
data:
| ! [![Pink potion.png](/images/7/79/Pink_potion.png)](/wiki/File:Pink_potion.png) |                                                               |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                             | wonder                                                        |
| Appearance                                                                       | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                                       | 200 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                                           | 20                                                            |
| Monster use                                                                      | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

A **potion of wonder** is a type of [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion") that appears in [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"). It can confer a variety of effects when [quaffed](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") or [dipped](/wiki/Dipped "Dipped") into.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
  - [1.1 Dipping](#Dipping)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 References](#References)

## Description

When quaffed, a noncursed potion will permanently give the player one of the following [intrinsics](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic"), while a cursed potion will remove one of the following:

- [Fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")
- [Cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")
- [Sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance")
- [Disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance")
- [Shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance")
- [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- [Acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance")
- [Stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance")
- [Regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration")
- [Searching](/wiki/Searching "Searching")
- [See invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible")
- [Invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility")
- [Teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis")
- [Teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control")
- [Polymorphitis](/wiki/Polymorphitis "Polymorphitis")
- [Polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control")
- [Levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") (as from eating a [ring of levitation](/wiki/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation"))
- [Stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")
- [Aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster")
- [Conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict")
- [Protection from shape changers](/wiki/Protection_from_shape_changers "Protection from shape changers")
- [Warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")
- [Telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy")
- [Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")
- [Restful sleep](/wiki/Restful_sleep "Restful sleep")
- [Water walking](/wiki/Water_walking "Water walking")
- [Hunger](/wiki/Hunger "Hunger")
- [Reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection")
- [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")
- [Displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement")
- [Clairvoyance](/wiki/Clairvoyance "Clairvoyance")
- [Energy regeneration](/wiki/Energy_regeneration "Energy regeneration")
- [Breathlessness](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless")
- [Sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance")
- [Drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance")
- Cancellation (prevents player spellcasting)
- [Free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action")
- [Swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming")
- [Flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying")
- [Unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging")
- [Phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing")
- [Infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision")
- Slowness (sets speed to 6)
- [Stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun") resistance
- [Death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance") (resistance to death magic)

The intrinsic lost or gained will be explicitly stated to the player; blessed potions will never grant the player an intrinsic they already have.

### Dipping

Dipping [weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon"), [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), [weapon-tools](/wiki/Weapon-tool "Weapon-tool"), and [jewelry](/wiki/Jewelry "Jewelry") into a potion of wonder will consume the potion and attempt to give the item a random object property appropriate to its class, or else remove one if the potion is cursed. Dipping [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") or other types of items have no effect and will not consume the potion.

If the potion is noncursed, there is a ![ {1}-(\frac{1}{n+1})](/images/math/d/7/0/d70d2d3698d043d6608ae5eb357ee3df.png) chance that all properties are lost and a ![(\frac{1}{n+1})](/images/math/b/6/8/b6899c027d0f4755d5aa4e1eb6391823.png) chance that a property is added, where *n* is the number of existing properties.

## Strategy

Quaffing the potion can be tempting, as many of the intrinsics are otherwise unattainable and can be quite alluring such as magic resistance and reflection. However, with such a variety of options, it's highly unlikely that you will obtain specific desirable intrinsics while risking dangerous ones such as polymorphitis and slowness. It's probably better to use this to give ordinary, replaceable equipment properties, as they can be easily discarded if they gain a useless or harmful property.

## References

- [potion.c 14(FIQHack)](https://github.com/FredrIQ/fiqhack/blob/6292ea1d04b5cabac2865a93e3ac0d6fa6adcb84/libnethack/src/potion.c#L14)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Potion of wonder

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
!
Name wonder
Appearance random
Base price 200 zm
Weight 20
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

A potion of wonder is a type of potion that appears in FIQHack. It can confer a variety of effects when quaffed or dipped into.

Contents

  • 1 Description
    • 1.1 Dipping
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 References

Description

When quaffed, a noncursed potion will permanently give the player one of the following intrinsics, while a cursed potion will remove one of the following:

  • Fire resistance
  • Cold resistance
  • Sleep resistance
  • Disintegration resistance
  • Shock resistance
  • Poison resistance
  • Acid resistance
  • Stoning resistance
  • Regeneration
  • Searching
  • See invisible
  • Invisibility
  • Teleportitis
  • Teleport control
  • Polymorphitis
  • Polymorph control
  • Levitation (as from eating a ring of levitation)
  • Stealth
  • Aggravate monster
  • Conflict
  • Protection from shape changers
  • Warning
  • Telepathy
  • Speed
  • Restful sleep
  • Water walking
  • Hunger
  • Reflection
  • Magic resistance
  • Displacement
  • Clairvoyance
  • Energy regeneration
  • Breathlessness
  • Sickness resistance
  • Drain resistance
  • Cancellation (prevents player spellcasting)
  • Free action
  • Swimming
  • Flying
  • Unchanging
  • Phasing
  • Infravision
  • Slowness (sets speed to 6)
  • Stun resistance
  • Death resistance (resistance to death magic)

The intrinsic lost or gained will be explicitly stated to the player; blessed potions will never grant the player an intrinsic they already have.

Dipping

Dipping weapons, armor, weapon-tools, and jewelry into a potion of wonder will consume the potion and attempt to give the item a random object property appropriate to its class, or else remove one if the potion is cursed. Dipping artifacts or other types of items have no effect and will not consume the potion.

If the potion is noncursed, there is a chance that all properties are lost and a chance that a property is added, where n is the number of existing properties.

Strategy

Quaffing the potion can be tempting, as many of the intrinsics are otherwise unattainable and can be quite alluring such as magic resistance and reflection. However, with such a variety of options, it's highly unlikely that you will obtain specific desirable intrinsics while risking dangerous ones such as polymorphitis and slowness. It's probably better to use this to give ordinary, replaceable equipment properties, as they can be easily discarded if they gain a useless or harmful property.

References

  • potion.c 14(FIQHack)

A '''potion of wonder''' is a type of [[potion]] that appears in [[FIQHack]]. It can confer a variety of effects when [[quaff]]ed or [[dipped]] into.

==Description== 
When quaffed, a noncursed potion will permanently give the player one of the following [[intrinsic]]s, while a cursed potion will remove one of the following:

* [[Fire resistance]]
* [[Cold resistance]]
* [[Sleep resistance]]

* [[Stun]] resistance
* [[Death resistance]] (resistance to death magic)

The intrinsic lost or gained will be explicitly stated to the player; blessed potions will never grant the player an intrinsic they already have.

===Dipping=== 
Dipping [[weapon]]s, [[armor]], [[weapon-tool]]s, and [[jewelry]] into a potion of wonder will consume the potion and attempt to give the item a random object property appropriate to its class, or else remove one if the potion is cursed. Dipping [[artifact]]s or other types of items have no effect and will not consume the potion.

If the potion is noncursed, there is a <math> {1}-(\frac{1}{n+1})</math> chance that all properties are lost and a <math>(\frac{1}{n+1})</math> chance that a property is added, where ''n'' is the number of existing properties.

==Strategy==
Quaffing the potion can be tempting, as many of the intrinsics are otherwise unattainable and can be quite alluring such as magic resistance and reflection. However, with such a variety of options, it's highly unlikely that you will obtain specific desirable intrinsics while risking dangerous ones such as polymorphitis and slowness. It's probably better to use this to give ordinary, replaceable equipment properties, as they can be easily discarded if they gain a useless or harmful property.
